SENT.plain: We report the case of a patient with bilateral and symmetrical T2 hyperintensities of the middle cerebellar peduncles
She had a history of left pontine infarction 8 months before
This was attributed to bilateral Wallerian degeneration
MR Spectroscopy showed decreased N-acetyl aspartate/Creatine (NAA/Cr) ratio in the cerebellar peduncles as well as in the whole cerebellum
We hypothesize that this could reflect neuronal degeneration following a stroke
